Protocols/CardVisibilityDelegate.html#/c.name: cardVisibility(cardVisibilityRatio:containerCoverageRatio:)
Protocols/CardVisibilityDelegate.html#/c.abstract: Notifies a card of the ratio that the card or screen is visible at any given time.

Protocols/CardPartsTheme.html#/cardPartM.name: cardPartMargins
Protocols/CardPartsTheme.html#/cardPartM.abstract: Default insets used in most CardPart*Views, ex: CardPartBarView

Protocols/NoTopBottomMarginsCardTrait.ht.name: requiresNoTopBottomMargins()
Protocols/NoTopBottomMarginsCardTrait.ht.abstract: Determines if card should not have top and bottom margins

Protocols/NoTopBottomMarginsCardTrait.ht.name: NoTopBottomMarginsCardTrait
Protocols/NoTopBottomMarginsCardTrait.ht.abstract: No Top or Bottom Margins Card trait

Protocols/CardPartsTheme.html.name: CardPartsTheme
Protocols/CardPartsTheme.html.abstract: Out of the box we support 2 themes: Mint and Turbo. These are the 2 Intuit app’s that are currently built on top of CardParts. As you can find in the file CardPartsTheme.swift we have a protocol called CardPartsTheme. You may create a class that conforms to CardPartsTheme and set all properties in order to theme CardParts however you may like.

Protocols/CardVisibilityDelegate.html.name: CardVisibilityDelegate
Protocols/CardVisibilityDelegate.html.abstract: This protocol handles passing data about the visibility of a card

Extensions/Reactive.html#/percent.name: percent
Extensions/Reactive.html#/percent.abstract: The value of percent has to be between 0 and 1.

Enums/ConfettiType.html#/mixed.name: mixed
Enums/ConfettiType.html#/mixed.abstract: provides a way to mix and macth multiple images as confetti particles.

Enums/ConfettiType.html#/image(_:).name: image(_:)
Enums/ConfettiType.html#/image(_:).abstract: provides option of displaying custom image as confetti particles.

Enums/ConfettiType.html.name: ConfettiType
Enums/ConfettiType.html.abstract: Enum which tells which type of confetti partciles to choose.

Enums/CardState.html.name: CardState
Enums/CardState.html.abstract: CardPartsViewController can optionally support the notion of card states, where a card can be in 3 different states: loading, empty, and hasData. For each state you can specify a unique set of card parts to display. Then when the CardPartsViewController state property is changed, the framework will automatically switch the card parts to display the card parts for that state. Typically you would bind the state property to a state property in your view model so that when the view model changes state the card parts are changed. A simple example:

Classes/CardsViewController.html#/collec.name: collectionView
Classes/CardsViewController.html#/collec.abstract: CollectionView containing array of cells to display Cards

Classes/CardsViewController.html#/viewDi.name: viewDidAppear(_:)
Classes/CardsViewController.html#/viewDi.abstract: functionality that happens when the view appears

Classes/CardsViewController.html#/loadCa.name: loadCards(cards:)
Classes/CardsViewController.html#/loadCa.abstract: Sets internal cardControllers to cards and registers cells for each card. Reloads data and invalidates layout.

Classes/CardsViewController.html#/regist.name: registerCells(cards:)
Classes/CardsViewController.html#/regist.abstract: Registers each card to the collectionView by its hashString

Classes/CardsViewController.html#/collec.name: collectionView(_:cellForItemAt:)
Classes/CardsViewController.html#/collec.abstract: Dequeues collection view cell. Constructs and applies delegates/protocols as needed if cell.cardContentView doesn’t already exist

Classes/CardsViewController.html#/keyboa.name: keyboardWillShow(notification:)
Classes/CardsViewController.html#/keyboa.abstract: Animates and offsets collectionView so that the input will not be hidden when keyboard is displayed

Classes/CardsViewController.html#/keyboa.name: keyboardWillHide(notification:)
Classes/CardsViewController.html#/keyboa.abstract: Animates and resets collectionView contentInsets when keyboard is being hidden

Classes/CardsViewController.html#/scroll.name: scrollViewDidScroll(_:)
Classes/CardsViewController.html#/scroll.abstract: calls for visibility of card when the scroll view scrolls

Classes/CardPartsViewController.html#/se.name: setupCardParts(_:forState:)
Classes/CardPartsViewController.html#/se.abstract: Sets up card parts storing state data, and stacking cards vertically

Classes/CardPartsViewController.html#/in.name: invalidateLayout(onChanges:)
Classes/CardPartsViewController.html#/in.abstract: Invalidate layout for any change from observables

Classes/CardPartTableViewCardPartsCell.h.abstract: Initialize cell with statckview, removing subviews and replacing with a new stackView as a subview

Classes/CardPartTableViewCardPartsCell.h.name: setupCardParts(_:)
Classes/CardPartTableViewCardPartsCell.h.abstract: Sets up and stacks CardPartView vertically, with margins

Classes/CardPartTitleView.html#/updateCo.name: updateConstraints()
Classes/CardPartTitleView.html#/updateCo.abstract: Update constraints based on button or not

Classes/CardPartTitleDescriptionView.htm.abstract: Initializes a CardPartTitleDescriptionView, defaulting to .top and CardParts theme secondaryTitlePosition

Classes/CardPartTitleDescriptionView.htm.name: updateConstraints()
Classes/CardPartTitleDescriptionView.htm.abstract: Update constraints based on title/description text existence and compression settings

Classes/CardPartLabel.html#/textRect(for.abstract: Modifies textRect based on insets and vertical alignment

Classes/CardPartTextField.html#/unformat.abstract: Returns the raw value, stripped of all formatting characters

Classes/CardPartTextField.html#/init(for.name: init(format:)
Classes/CardPartTextField.html#/init(for.abstract: Initializes with format (.none by default) and subscribes to textChangeNotification

Classes/CardPartTableViewCell.html#/init.name: init(style:reuseIdentifier:)
Classes/CardPartTableViewCell.html#/init.abstract: Initializes tableViewCell placing left, right title’s and description as subviews

Classes/CardPartTableViewCell.html#/upda.abstract: Update constraints, considering if description labels are empty, and compression settings

Classes/CardPartTableView.html#/tableVie.abstract: Asks the delegate for height or defaults to rowHeight

Classes/CardPartStackView.html#/pinBackg.name: pinBackground(_:to:)
Classes/CardPartStackView.html#/pinBackg.abstract: Pins background to leading, trailing, top, bottom

Classes/CardPartSeparatorView.html#/init.abstract: Initialize with backgroundColor set to CardParts theme separatorColor

Classes/CardPartRadioButton.html#/circle.abstract: Circle radius, computation of smaller size minus outer line width

Classes/CardPartProgressBarView.html#/in.abstract: Initializes progress bar with colors, optional marker and marker label, at currentValue, with a width. Conditionally shows bar values.

Classes/CardPartPillLabel.html#/intrinsi.abstract: returns new size with updated vertical and horizantal padding.

Classes/CardPartPagedView.html#/init(wit.abstract: Instantiate a paged view with pages, and desired height

Classes/CardPartPagedView.html#/updateCo.abstract: Update constraints with horizontal and vertical padding

Classes/CardPartPagedView.html#/scrollVi.name: scrollViewDidEndDecelerating(_:)
Classes/CardPartPagedView.html#/scrollVi.abstract: Snaps page based on swiped/scrolled amount and calls didMoveToPage delegate

Classes/CardPartOrientedView.html#/init(.abstract: Takes an array of CardPartViews and arranges them to Orientation

Classes/CardPartMapView.html#/mapView.name: mapView
Classes/CardPartMapView.html#/mapView.abstract: The instance of MKMapView used inside of the CardPartMapView

Classes/CardPartMapView.html#/intrensicH.name: intrensicHeight
Classes/CardPartMapView.html#/intrensicH.abstract: The height of the CardPartMapView. Default is 300 points. Override this to set a custom height.

Classes/CardPartMapView.html#/init(type:.abstract: Initializes map of type at location using span

Classes/CardPartIconLabel.html#/iconPadd.abstract: additional spacing between text and the image

Classes/CardPartIconLabel.html#/drawText.abstract: Draws label text specially within the frame with icon

Classes/CardPartIconLabel.html#/intrinsi.abstract: returns new size with updated vertical and horizantal padding.

Classes/CardPartIconLabel.html#/tapIconG.abstract: here we create tapGesture recognizer and store the closure user passed to us in the associated object.

Classes/CardPartBarView.html#/percent.name: percent
Classes/CardPartBarView.html#/percent.abstract: The value of percent has to be between 0 and 1.

Classes/CardPartBarView.html#/init().name: init()
Classes/CardPartBarView.html#/init().abstract: Setup background layer, backgroundColor, and initialize barLayer and verticalLine. Conditionally add verticalLine if showTodayLine is enabled in the theme

Classes/CardPartBarView.html.name: CardPartBarView
Classes/CardPartBarView.html.abstract: CardPartBarView present a horizontal bar graph that can be filled to a certain percentage of your choice. Both the color of the fill and the percent is reactive

Classes/CardPartCenteredView.html.name: CardPartCenteredView
Classes/CardPartCenteredView.html.abstract: CardPartCenteredView is a CardPart that fits a centered card part proportionally on the phone screen while allowing a left and right side card part to scale appropriately.

Classes/CardPartCollectionView.html.name: CardPartCollectionView
Classes/CardPartCollectionView.html.abstract: CardPartCollectionView underlying engine is RxDataSource. You can look at their documentation for a deeper look but here is an overall approach to how it works:

Classes/CardPartCollectionViewCardPartsC.name: CardPartCollectionViewCardPartsCell
Classes/CardPartCollectionViewCardPartsC.abstract: Just how CardPartTableViewCell has the ability to create tableView cells out of CardParts - so do CollectionViews. Below is an example of how you may create a custom CardPartCollectionViewCardPartsCell:

Classes/CardPartConfettiView.html.name: CardPartConfettiView
Classes/CardPartConfettiView.html.abstract: Provides the capability to add confetti with various types ( diamonds, star, mixed ) and colors, along with different level of intensity

Classes/CardPartIconLabel.html.name: CardPartIconLabel
Classes/CardPartIconLabel.html.abstract: CardPartIconLabel provides the capability to add images in either directions supporting left , right and center text alignments.

Classes/CardPartImageView.html.name: CardPartImageView
Classes/CardPartImageView.html.abstract: CardPartImageView displays a single image. CardPartImageView exposes the following reactive properties that can be bound to view model properties:

Classes/CardPartMapView.html.name: CardPartMapView
Classes/CardPartMapView.html.abstract: CardPartMapView provides the capability to display a MapView and reactively configure location, map type, and coordinate span (zoom). You also have direct access to the MKMapView instance so that you can add annotations, hook into it’s MKMapViewDelegate, or whatever else you’d normally do with Maps.

Classes/CardPartOrientedView.html.name: CardPartOrientedView
Classes/CardPartOrientedView.html.abstract: CardPartOrientedView allows you to create an oriented list view of card part elements. This is similar to the CardPartStackView except that this view can orient elements to the top or bottom of the view. This is advantageous when you are using horizontal stack views and need elements to be oriented differently (top arranged or bottom arranged) relative to the other views in the horizontal stack view. To see a good example of this element please take a look at the example application.

Classes/CardPartPagedView.html.name: CardPartPagedView
Classes/CardPartPagedView.html.abstract: This CardPart allows you to create a horizontal paged carousel with page controls. Simply feed it with your desired height and an array of CardPartStackView:

Classes/CardPartPillLabel.html.name: CardPartPillLabel
Classes/CardPartPillLabel.html.abstract: CardPartPillLabel provides you the rounded corners, text aligned being at the center along with vertical and horizontal padding capability.

Classes/CardPartProgressBarView.html.name: CardPartProgressBarView
Classes/CardPartProgressBarView.html.abstract: ProgressBarView provides the capability to configure different colors and custom marker , it’s position to indicate the progress based on the value provided.

Classes/CardPartRadioButton.html.name: CardPartRadioButton
Classes/CardPartRadioButton.html.abstract: Provides the capability to add radio buttons with configurable inner/outer circle line width , colors along with tap etc..

Classes/CardPartSeparatorView.html.name: CardPartSeparatorView
Classes/CardPartSeparatorView.html.abstract: CardPartSeparatorView displays a separator line. There are no reactive properties define for CardPartSeparatorView.

Classes/CardPartSliderView.html.name: CardPartSliderView
Classes/CardPartSliderView.html.abstract: You can set min and max value as well as bind to the current set amount:

Classes/CardPartSpacerView.html.name: CardPartSpacerView
Classes/CardPartSpacerView.html.abstract: Allows you to add a space between card parts in case you need a space larger than the default margin. Initialize it with a specific height:

Classes/CardPartStackView.html.name: CardPartStackView
Classes/CardPartStackView.html.abstract: CardPartStackView displays a UIStackView that can contain other card parts, and even other CardPartStackViews. Using CardPartStackView allows for creating custom layouts of card parts. By nesting CardPartStackViews you can create almost any layout.

Classes/CardPartTableView.html.name: CardPartTableView
Classes/CardPartTableView.html.abstract: CardPartTableView displays a table view as a card part such that all items in the table view are displayed in the card part (i.e. the table view does not scroll). CardPartTableView leverages Bond’s reactive data source support allowing a MutableObservableArray to be bound to the table view.

Classes/CardPartTableViewCell.html.name: CardPartTableViewCell
Classes/CardPartTableViewCell.html.abstract: CardPartTableViewCell is the default cell registered for CardPartTableView. The cell contains the following properties:

Classes/CardPartTextField.html.name: CardPartTextField
Classes/CardPartTextField.html.abstract: CardPartTextField can take a parameter of type CardPartTextFieldFormat which determines formatting for the UITextField. You may also set properties such as keyboardType, placeholder, font, text, etc.

Classes/CardPartTextView.html.name: CardPartTextView
Classes/CardPartTextView.html.abstract: CardPartTextView displays a single text string. The string can wrap to multiple lines. The initializer for CardPartTextView takes a type parameter which can be set to: normal, title, or detail. The type is used to set the default font and textColor for the text.

Classes/CardPartTitleDescriptionView.htm.name: CardPartTitleDescriptionView
Classes/CardPartTitleDescriptionView.htm.abstract: CardPartTitleDescriptionView allows you to have a left and right title and description label, however, you are able to also choose the alignment of the right title/description labels. See below:

Classes/CardPartTitleView.html.name: CardPartTitleView
Classes/CardPartTitleView.html.abstract: CardPartTitleView displays a view with a title, and an optional options menu. The initializer requires a type parameter which can be set to either titleOnly or titleWithMenu. If the type is set to titleWithMenu the card part will display a menu icon, that when tapped will display a menu containing the options specified in the menuOptions array. The menuOptionObserver property can be set to a block that will be called when the user selects an item from the menu.

Classes/CardPartVerticalSeparatorView.ht.name: CardPartVerticalSeparatorView
Classes/CardPartVerticalSeparatorView.ht.abstract: As the name describes, it shows a vertical separator view opposed to a horizontal one

Classes/CardPartTableViewCardPartsCell.h.name: CardPartTableViewCardPartsCell
Classes/CardPartTableViewCardPartsCell.h.abstract: This will give you the ability to create custom tableView cells out of CardParts. The following code allows you to create a cell:

Classes/CardPartsFullScreenViewControlle.name: CardPartsFullScreenViewController
Classes/CardPartsFullScreenViewControlle.abstract: This will make the card a full screen view controller. So if you do not want to build with an array of Cards, instead you can make a singular card full-screen.

Classes/CardPartsViewController.html.name: CardPartsViewController
Classes/CardPartsViewController.html.abstract: CardPartsViewController implements the CardController protocol and builds its card UI by displaying one or more card part views using an MVVM pattern that includes automatic data binding. Each CardPartsViewController displays a list of CardPartView as its subviews. Each CardPartView renders as a row in the card. The CardParts framework implements several different types of CardPartView that display basic views, such as title, text, image, button, separator, etc. All CardPartView implemented by the framework are already styled to correctly match the applied themes UI guidelines.

Classes/CardsViewController.html.name: CardsViewController
Classes/CardsViewController.html.abstract: The CardsViewController uses a collection view where each cell is a single card. The cells will render the frames for the cards, but are designed to have a child ViewController that will display the contents of the card. Thus CardsViewController is essentially a list of child view controllers that are rendered in special cells that draw the card frames.

Classes.html#/LayoutProxy.name: LayoutProxy
Classes.html#/LayoutProxy.abstract: Provides an object that will acts a proxy for the view that we’re currenlty defining layout for.
